Ingredients.7: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.12: 2 pounds flat iron steak, cut into 3-inch squares

Ingredients.17: 1 chopped fresh parsley, or as needed

Directions.1: Heat milk and cream in a saucepan over medium heat until simmering, about 5 minutes. Slowly whip in Parmesan and Romano cheeses and remove from heat. Whisk egg yolks together in a heat-proof bowl and slowly add about 1/4 cup of the hot sauce to temper eggs. Whisk egg mixture into the saucepan slowly. Season with salt and pepper. Allow Alfredo sauce to cool and refrigerate until needed.

Directions.2: Combine salad dressing, rosemary, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add steak and stir to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours.

Directions.3: When ready to prepare the meal, preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.

Directions.4: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.

Directions.5: Heat 2 cups refrigerated Alfredo sauce in a saucepan over medium heat. Add spinach and 2 tablespoons Gorgonzola cheese.

Directions.6: Remove steak from marinade and cook on the preheated grill to desired doneness, 5 to 10 minutes.

Directions.7: Pour hot Alfredo sauce into a large serving bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix to combine. Sprinkle remaining Gorgonzola cheese on top. Add grilled steak and drizzle the meat with balsamic glaze. Garnish with parsley.
